Display a CC

Source: R/get_pep_prot_CC.R
pep_prot_CC.Rd

xxxx

Usage

buildGraph(cc, metadata = NULL)

display.CC.visNet(
  g,
  layout = "layout_with_fr",
  obj = NULL,
  prot.tooltip = NULL,
  pept.tooltip = NULL
)

plotCCJitter(df, clickFunction = NULL)

GetCCInfos(cc)

Arguments

cc

xxx

metadata

xxx

g

A cc (a list)

layout

xxxxx

obj

xxx

prot.tooltip

xxx

pept.tooltip

xxx

df

xxxx

clickFunction

xxxx

Value

A list

A plot

A plot

A list of three items:

  • One_One: the number of cc composed of one protein and one peptide

  • One_Multi: the number of cc composed of one protein and several peptides

  • Multi_Multi: the number of cc composed of several proteins and several (shared) peptides.

Author

Thomas Burger, Samuel Wieczorek

Examples

data(sub_R25_pept)
#> Warning: data set 'sub_R25_pept' not found
se1 <- sub_R25_pept[[1]]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'sub_R25_pept' not found
g <- buildGraph(get_cc(se1)[[11]])
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'ncol': error in evaluating the argument 'object' in selecting a method for function 'get_cc': object 'se1' not found
display.CC.visNet(g)
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'g' not found


data(sub_R25_pept)
#> Warning: data set 'sub_R25_pept' not found
GetCCInfos(get_cc(sub_R25_pept[[1]]))
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'object' in selecting a method for function 'get_cc': object 'sub_R25_pept' not found
